alert.note: Alert for Inland Nueces; Inland San Patricio; Jim Wells (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 9:09PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Nueces, southwestern San Patricio and northeastern Jim Wells Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 909 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Banquete, or 11 miles west of Robstown, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 40 mph, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bluntzer around 925 PM CDT. San Patricio around 935 PM CDT. Edroy around 945 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Agua Dulce and Lake Alice. This includes the following highways... Interstate 37 between mile markers 16 and 21, and between mile markers 25 and 35. US Highway 77 near mile marker 658. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Inland Nueces; Inland San Patricio; Jim Wells
